FuncDef:
The snmp-agent trap source ipv6 ipv6-address command is used to configure the SNMP trap IPv6 source address.
The undo snmp-agent trap source ipv6 command is used to clear the SNMP trap IPv6 source address. The snmp-agent trap source ipv6 ipv6-address command is used to configure the SNMP trap IPv6 source address. The undo snmp-agent trap source ipv6 command is used to clear the SNMP trap IPv6 source address. By default, no source IPv6 address is configured to target IPv6 host for SNMP Trap.

ParaDef.Info:
Specify source IPv6 address of snmp traps packet.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.
On a VPN network, use the VPN instance specified using vpn-instance, IP address, and security name together to identify a target host.

ExtraInfo: When a device sends SNMP trap packets to an IPv6 destination host, you can run the snmp-agent trap source ipv6 command to specify the source IPv6 address for sending SNMP trap packets.
